body:
Antonio,

I can't say that I have steady access to DesignBuilder but maybe I can test your case in my company's office one day after work.  I can say that, generally, you will get a much more robust response from the ladybug community if your gbxml issues are framed in an OpenStudio context (being free and open source).  So, if you are able to replicate your problems in OpenStudio, we can probably solve them much more quickly.

I can also confirm that a "virtual partition" is an invention of DesignBuilder and is not something that EnergyPlus intrinsically understands (or, rather, a "virtual partition" can mean a lot of different things to EnergyPlus depending on how it is input).  So, if DesignBuilder is not interpreting the air walls as virtual partitions now, it seems unlikely that the situation will change unless the DesignBuilder team makes their software more amenable to gbxml's format.

-Chris
